title: How to Make a Fishtail Braid: A Step-By-Step Tutorial

steps.title: Divide your hair
steps.content: Divide your hair into 2 even sections. You will have a left piece and a right piece.

steps.title: Take a thin strand of hair from the left section.
steps.content: Take a thin strand of hair from the left section. Gather it from the outside. It should be no thicker than 0.5 in (1.3 cm). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the thin strand up and across the left section.
steps.content: Pull the thin strand up and across the left section. Move it towards the right 1.

steps.title: Tuck the thin strand under the right section.
steps.content: Tuck the thin strand under the right section. It will now become part of the right section.

steps.title: Tug gently on the 2 sections to tighten them.
steps.content: Tug gently on the 2 sections to tighten them. Move your hands up as far as they can go. The tighter you make your braid, the better; you can always tousle it for a messier look later.

steps.title: Take a thin strand from the right section.
steps.content: Take a thin strand from the right section. Gather it from the outside of the section, and make it no thicker than 0.5 in (1.3 cm).

steps.title: Pull the thin strand up and across the right section.
steps.content: Pull the thin strand up and across the right section. Move it towards the left section.

steps.title: Tuck it under the left section.
steps.content: Tuck it under the left section. It is now part of the left section.

steps.title: Keep alternating sides until you reach the end of your hair.
steps.content: Keep alternating sides until you reach the end of your hair. Leave at least 1 in (2.5 cm) of your hair unbraided so that you can tie it off. Try to use thinner strands the further down you go on your braid. [3] X Research source This will help make your braid look more even; your hair becomes naturally thinner towards the ends.

steps.title: Wrap a hair tie around the end of your hair.
steps.content: Wrap a hair tie around the end of your hair. If you want, you can take a strand of hair, and wrap it around the hair tie to hide it. Secure the strand with a bobby pin .

steps.title: Create a tousled braid by rubbing it between your hands.
steps.content: Create a tousled braid by rubbing it between your hands. You may want to skip this if your hair has lots of layers; it may end up loosening and getting tousled on its own.

steps.title: Gather up a section of hair at the crown of your head.
steps.content: Gather up a section of hair at the crown of your head. Try to keep it at eye level or higher. Make it as centered as you can.

steps.title: Split the section into 2 halves.
steps.content: Split the section into 2 halves. You will have a left half and a right half.

steps.title: Pull up a thin strand from the left side of your head.
steps.content: Pull up a thin strand from the left side of your head. Try to gather it from your hairline. Make the strand thin, and no larger than 0.5 in (1.3 cm).

steps.title: Pull the thin strand across the left section and towards the right.
steps.content: Pull the thin strand across the left section and towards the right.

steps.title: Tuck the thin strand under the right section.
steps.content: Tuck the thin strand under the right section. It will be a part of the right section from now on.

steps.title: Pull a thin strand of hair from the right side of your head.
steps.content: Pull a thin strand of hair from the right side of your head. Make sure that this strand is the same distance from the center of your head as the strand you pulled from the left side. Again, make sure that it is no thicker than 0.5 in (1.3 cm).

steps.title: Pull it across the right section and towards the left.
steps.content: Pull it across the right section and towards the left.

steps.title: Tuck the thin strand under the left section.
steps.content: Tuck the thin strand under the left section. It will be a part of the left section from now on.

steps.title: Pull up a new center section.
steps.content: Pull up a new center section. This section should be equal in size to the first section you pulled up. Fold it across to the left side as you did with the first center section.

steps.title: Keep alternating sides until you reach the base of your head.
steps.content: Keep alternating sides until you reach the base of your head. At this point, you can tie your hair off, or keep braiding it.

steps.title: Continue braiding your hair in the fishtail fashion.
steps.content: Continue braiding your hair in the fishtail fashion. Try to keep the braid as tight and smooth as possible. You can always tussle it up later.

steps.title: Tie the braid off towards the end.
steps.content: Tie the braid off towards the end. When you have about 1 in (2.5 cm) left of hair, tie the braid off using a hair tie.

steps.title: Create a messy fishtail braid by gently tugging on the edges.
steps.content: Create a messy fishtail braid by gently tugging on the edges. Keep in mind that if you have lots of layers in your hair, the braid will become messy on its own.

steps.title: Find some thin hair elastics that match your hair color.
steps.content: Find some thin hair elastics that match your hair color. You can also use clear ones if you can't find any that match your hair. You will be making several topsy-turvy ponytails, right after the other, so make sure that you have enough. This braid will work best on longer hair. It may not work very well on hair that is shorter than the upper arm.

steps.title: Pull your hair into a low ponytail.
steps.content: Pull your hair into a low ponytail . Try to make the ponytail as close to the base of your head as possible, but don't make it too tight.

steps.title: Create a topsy-turvy ponytail.
steps.content: Create a topsy-turvy ponytail. Start by slipping your pointer and middle fingers through your hair, right above the elastic. Split your fingers apart, creating a hole. Pull the ponytail over the elastic and down through the hole. Tug gently and smooth down your hair.

steps.title: Tie another elastic around your hair a few inches down from the first 1.
steps.content: Tie another elastic around your hair a few inches down from the first 1. If you have thin or fine hair, tie the elastic closer to the first 1. If you have thick hair, tie it a little bit further away.

steps.title: Create another topsy-turvy ponytail.
steps.content: Create another topsy-turvy ponytail. Slip your fingers through your hair, just above the elastic, and make another hole. Pull the tail down through the hole.

steps.title: Keep doing this until you have only a few inches of your hair left.
steps.content: Keep doing this until you have only a few inches of your hair left. Tie your hair off with a hair tie.

steps.title: Consider hiding the elastics.
steps.content: Consider hiding the elastics. You can do this by gently tugging on strands of hair to fluff them out a little. You can also wrap colored bits of ribbon or string around the elastics. Add some colorful beads for a boho or festival look.

steps.title: Make a side fishtail braid.
steps.content: Make a side fishtail braid. Start by gathering your hair into a low ponytail, and pulling it either to the left or right of your neck. Tie it off with a clear elastic. Fishtail braid your hair as usual and tie it off. Snip the clear elastic off when you are done.

steps.title: Try making a topsy-turvy ponytail before you start doing the fishtail braid.
steps.content: Try making a topsy-turvy ponytail before you start doing the fishtail braid. Start with a low ponytail. Slip your fingers up through your hair, right between the nape and the elastic. Pull the ponytail down through the hole. Once you have flipped your ponytail, start fishtail braiding as usual. Try poking a flower or 2 into the hole of the topsy-turvy for a cute, boho look.

steps.title: Use a clip or barrette to cover up the hair tie.
steps.content: Use a clip or barrette to cover up the hair tie. You can also tie a ribbon over the hair tie in a bow. This can help make your braid more interesting and complete your outfit.

steps.title: Roll your braid into a bun at the nape of your neck.
steps.content: Roll your braid into a bun at the nape of your neck. Keep it in place with a few bobby pins. This will be especially effective if you have really long hair.

steps.title: Add some colored hair extensions before you start braiding your hair.
steps.content: Add some colored hair extensions before you start braiding your hair. This will give your braid a spark of color, and make it look more interesting. Fold a single clip in extension over the base of your ponytail and then work it into the braid.
